Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists in the form of the full remarks made by President-elect Joe Biden, which clarify that his goal was to have a majority of schools open by the end of his first 100 days in office, rather than specifically reopening in January 2021.
Understate: The claim may potentially understate the timeline for reopening in-person learning in public schools by suggesting that it would happen in January 2021, when the full remarks indicate a goal of having a majority of schools open by the end of Biden's first 100 days in office.
Exaggerate: The claim may potentially exaggerate the announcement made by President-elect Joe Biden by suggesting that he planned to reopen in-person learning in public schools in January 2021, when the full remarks indicate a goal of having a majority of schools open by the end of his first 100 days in office.
